column4: can someine tell me how to hide the sidebar on ubuntu 11.04?please help
If you maximize the window you are working in, it auto-hides
You want to completely remove it?
: Yes,i want to use Ubuntu classic without it
Have you logged out of Unity and switched to Classic?
: yes to see if it change my setting on the top bar
Let me try a few things
: OK
: have you found anything?
Nothing so far, was doing some research but not finding much info on it

: hmmm......i was using classic edition so far,ichange to ubuntu (normal to see if there will be changes)and now it have stuck in ubuntu classic,can i hide it somehow and use the top and bot bar as in ubuntu 10.10?
From what I have read so far that doesn't seem to be an option. Wish I could have been more help.
: no it's ok man thanks for the help,it seem i will format becouse i hate it,are you using it anyway?
I'm giving it a shot. I was one of the lucky ones that had everything work well for me
Firefox4 although is having some problems staying full screen.
: xaxaxa nice, thanks again!see ya around
: i found the solution,whana hear it?
sure
Sure, what did you find?
: if someone dont like it he have just to type (sudo apt-get remove unity)that works for me,and now i am using ubuntu classic version without the side bar!
Nice. In a month or so will you give gnome3 a try?
: gnome3?i haven't hear of it....what's that?
